title: How to beat bookies: Punter called 'The Professor' has 78 counts of fraud thrown out
text:
Stephen Fletcher, 47, used the online betting accounts of his friends, allegedly including two police officers, to stay one step ahead of bookies who became suspicious

A punter dubbed 'The Professor' for his ability to calculate odds has had 78 counts of fraud dismissed after a court found he did nothing wrong by using his mates betting accounts.

Stephen Fletcher, 47, used the online betting accounts of his friends, allegedly including two police officers, to stay one step ahead of bookies who became suspicious, according to The Daily Telegraph.

Fletcher, who once pulled off a legal $1 million betting sting, placed bets ranging from $9 to tens of thousands of dollars using the so-called 'bowler' accounts, the court heard.

His own account with online betting agency Sportingbet had restrictions placed on it while his other account with Bet365 had been closed.

Judge Sophia Beckett found that the prosecution did not prove Fletcher had obtained financial advantage dishonestly by using the other accounts because he still had no influence on who won races.

'The financial advantage did not arise until the horse or dog he placed a bet on won. There is no evidence the accused had any influence over that result. Sometimes he won, sometimes he lost,' Beckett said.

Fletcher, who once pulled off a legal $1 million betting sting, placed bets ranging from $9 to tens of thousands of dollars using the so-called 'bowler' accounts (file image)

She discharged the jury after the four week trial and directed them to find not guilty on all charges.

Fletcher's scheme involved a highly organised 'cat and mouse' game with bookies where he would move onto other accounts to not raise suspicion and prevent bookmakers from adjusting odds or limiting bets.

His betting activity range from Australian regional races through to overseas races in locations such as Hong Kong.

The biggest win during the scheme was in February 2013 when he won $56,000 from a $1600 bet on Alma's Fury at Warwick Farm racetrack.

In 2005 Mr Fletcher famously won $1 million after betting greyhound Lucy's Light on the Gold Coast.

He was also involved in a 2006 wager for underdogs the Warriors to beat Knights in an NRL game that netted the betting syndicate an estimated $2 million.
